title: Night Court at the Twilight of the Adams Administration
description: I spent five nights at Manhattan's night court and wrote this long-form narrative story exploring the history of night court and criminalization of low-level offenses in New York City.

title: Mamdani Campaigners Are Optimistic About Winning Staten Island
description: Reported live from Staten Island on the New York City mayoral election, producing three spot stories, including a story following Mamdani campaigners in the 'forgotten boroough'.

title: ‘COVID Days’ for NYC Teachers Ended, Even as Rates Were Rising
description: Wrote this story on how New York City public school teachers lost 'COVID days' all while COVID rates were still on the rise.

title: Kickstarter Employees Launch Strike Over Four-Day Workweek, Pay Floor
description: Reported the historic strike of Kickstarter United, which was one of the first tech companies to unionize in 2020.

title: Thousands Marched For Charter Schools Ahead of the Mayoral Election. Staff Say They Were Forced To Attend
description: Follow-up story with additional reporting after attending the rally, which drew an attendance of 15,000 and had the rapper Common as a headliner.

title: ‘Rally Attendance is Mandatory.’ Staff Say Charter Schools Are Forcing Advocacy Ahead of Mayoral Election
description: Exclusive leaked documents and recordings went into my first solo reported story, cited in a letter by New York state senators.

title: 'They Just Fired Everyone.' Staff at Hotel Bar Lose Jobs Days After Union Filing
description: Hikari Mae Hida and I reported this story on the terminations of all staff at Rose Lane bar and restaurant, four days after filing a union petition with the NLRB.

title: What we know (and what we don't know) about BPD’s surveillance camera network
description: Boston Police Department has 1,300+ surveillance cameras at their disposal. I analyzed how these cameras being used and where they are deployed.

title: We saved hundreds of Biden-era AI documents, so you don’t have to
description: In anticipation of the new administration, I archived hundreds of tech policy documents from government websites, including executive orders, FTC complaints, spreadsheets and blogposts.

title: Eyes in the Sky: Big Brother is (still) watching
description: I analyzed records from the FAA to see which Massachusetts government agencies were using drones, finding that many models were prone to crashes. I also updated the dashboard to have more functionality.

title: Boston Police Records Show Nearly 70 Percent of ShotSpotter Alerts Led to Dead Ends
description: I conducted the largest analysis of Boston's ShotSpotter system to date, spurring a letter from Senator Markey, Senator Warren and Representative Pressley to the DHS Office of the Inspector General.

title: Yes, All Location Data: Separating fact from myth in industry talking points about “anonymous” location data
description: I wrote an explainer on how location data can be de-anonymized from just a few data points, referencing peer-reviewed academic research on privacy bounds.

title: Balancing the scales of justice: Why right to counsel in eviction cases is a racial justice and housing justice issue
description: I analyzed eviction rates to support a proposed bill in the Massachusetts state legislature that sought to expand access to counsel in housing cases.

title: Our Digital Lives Are Too Fragile
description: Evernote killed its free tier, and I missed a coworker's birthday drinks trying to salvage my notes. Based on that experience, I wrote an essay on the fragility of our digital lives in the modern age.

title: Roadblock to Care: Barriers to Out-of-State Travel for Abortion and Gender Affirming Care
description: I researched ways in which out-of-state heathcare seekers could be surveilled through different forms of transportation and accommodation choices, writing this report with a large team of collaborators.

title: ChatGPT for therapy? Houston, we have a problem
description: I wrote an op-ed on why ChatGPT shouldn't be used for therapy. This piece was drafted through the Public Voices Fellowship on Technology in the Public Interest, an initiative of The OpEd Project.

title: POV: NYPD’s robodogs are being paid for in the shadiest way possible
description: After Mayor Adams purchased a robot police dog with $750,000 in asset forfeiture funds, I wrote this op-ed to explain how police use these funds to buy surveillance techologies, dodging procurement oversight.
